item.description:
Ok since most of you can now handle a simple 9 mile trip down stream.. Here is another downstream trip..
I checked the tide tables, things look good so far for saturday or sunday as a back up day.

The places on the list can be seen in one day but if some are too tired we can stop in a nice area right across from seldon island, (deep river dock) and skip hamburger..
then go to the cars in Essex.

Bring some lunch and water..the usual acessories...

Getting to the start point:
From Hartford,
Take rte 9 south to exit # 7
Take the connector (rte 82) to the Goodspeed oprah house..(left on 154, Middlesex tpk then the first right back onto 82= Bridge road.
Cross the CT River bridge, pass the Goodspeed and Gelston House, take the just past the Gelston house = Lumber Yard road...go past the Goodspeed parking lot take the first right into the grass boat ramp are lot just before the fence.
For Mapquest, GPS and others, 14 lumber yard road, east haddam, ct that will get you close enough...

Essex drop car off:
from the Gelston House go back to rte 9..
Rte 9 south to exit #3
take a left on to 154 = main st then a left onto west avenue, if you missed this the next left is 153, take a left there= west ave, its a triangle thing,
ok when on west ave go into the town a bit around in half circle untill you see a 4 way intersection with North Main street,
take north main by going strait till you get to the first right, thats bushnell, take the right onto bushnell, go a short ways look left, (bushnell park boat ramp) for a grassy lot, i think its called Teal Lane
Mapquest, GPS and others, put in #1 Teal Lane, Essex CT or if that dont work just try Bushnell st, essex, ct

LOOK AT YOUR MAPS...

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: CT River Coves, Chapman, Waleboane, Seldon, Hamburger..
